page.title: 18THE ANKERS HOUSE PROJECT
page.content: The Ankers House or Hermitage attached to the Parish Church is probably the most complete example in England.In the Middle Ages there were about 6 anchorages in County Durham and hermits lived in the cell at Chester- le-Street,walled up for life in prayer ,contemplation and fasting.They watched Church services through a squint hole.A scheme to restore and convert the anchorage into a small museum,costing Â£40,000 ,was started in 1983.It is hoped to open the Ankers House on St. Cuthberts Day,20 March 1986.To emphasise the project a small housing development called the Anchorage is being built nearby.
